result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin D Runke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and attorney fees paid in full from bond posted.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Anger management counseling and treatment deemed appropriate. AODA and follow up deemed appropriate. No contact with SM. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Random testing.

timeConds.notes: The court has no objection for the def to serve the jail portion in a county other than Ozaukee if the Sheriffs of both counties agree to the arrangements. Submit to DNA analysis.

01:38 PM Defendant Kevin D Runke in custody and appears by video conferencing from the Oz Cty Jail with attorney Heather Dvoran appearing as a friend of the court. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading. Defendant does not qualify for PD Representation. Court review charges/penalties, right to counsel and finds probable cause.  State requests $15,000 cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits on prelim to allow defendant time to retain counsel and sets matter over for status.  Status hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
